title: EIP-7807: SSZ execution blocks
description: Migrates execution blocks to Simple Serialize (SSZ), enabling a unified block representation across CL and EL. Changes block hash to hash_tree_root, converts transactions/receipts/withdrawals roots to SSZ, and introduces a binary engine API replacing JSON encoding.
author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech)
laymanDescription: Converts Ethereum's execution block format from RLP encoding to SSZ, a more efficient binary format already used by the consensus layer. This enables faster data exchange between clients and allows proving individual pieces of block data.

scaleBlobs.description: Binary engine API alleviates latency bottleneck from JSON encoding at higher blob counts.

improveUX.description: Tree-based hashes enable trustless wallets that can verify partial transaction data without third parties.

appDevs.description: Less maintenance for verifying applications consuming transaction/receipt fields.

walletDevs.description: Enables building trustless wallets with provable partial data.

toolingInfra.description: Binary API reduces encoding/parsing overhead by ~50%.

layer2s.description: Simpler verification with tree-based proofs of partial block data.

stakersNodes.description: Simpler sync without RLP/MPT conversion overhead.

clClients.description: Can compute block hash autonomously, dropping async EL communication during sync.

elClients.description: Significant implementation work for SSZ library, database, and networking changes.

benefits: Tree-based hashes enable proofs of partial data for smart contracts and light clients.
Binary engine API reduces data exchange size by ~50% and improves encoding efficiency.
Forward-compatible proofs reduce maintenance when Ethereum upgrades add new fields.
Simplifies CL sync by removing RLP/MPT dependencies.
tradeoffs: Breaks compatibility with contracts depending on previous block header binary format.
Requires database and network protocol changes across all client implementations.
